Uses of Interface
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom.XYZ

Packages that use XYZ
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet Contains the parameter objects and the top level user interface and examples for the Fracplanet port. 
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom Contains all geometry related classes including points, vertices, triangles, flat and spherical geometries and the meshes and terrains that are built out of them. 
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.io Contains I/O related functionality including POV export and colour file processing. 
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.noise Contains code related to noise generation. 
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.render Contains code concerned with terrain rendering and display. 
com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.rings Contains code to integrate with the Rings Raytracer

Classes in com.alvermont.terraj.fracplanet.geom that implement XYZ
 class ImmutableXYZ
          Class for XYZ values that can't be modified after creation.
 class RandomXYZInBox
          Class that extends XYZ and generates random points in a bounding box
 class RandomXYZInSphere
          Generates random points in or on a unit sphere (origin centred)
 class RandomXYZSphereNormal
          Creates random points normal to a sphere
 class SimpleXYZ
          Represents a 3D coordinate
protected  class VertexBufferArray.BufferedXYZ
          Class to act as a proxy on elements within the buffer and make them look like XYZ objects.

 XYZ Geometry.perturb(XYZ v, XYZ variation)
          Adds a random peturbation to a point up to the specified amount
 XYZ FlatGeometry.perturb(XYZ p, XYZ variation)
          Adds a random peturbation to a point up to the specified amount The correct thing to do would be to return p+RandomXYZInEllipsoid(_r01,variation); however, this uses a variable number of random number calls which means small parameter changes can have big effects on generated terrain.
